uEzJPXIe-_QQfKgOkUNSRw.text: Update time:  How easy is it to win me back?  Remind me how good your hoagies are, that they're not overpriced like the Pizza is, and then serve me endless glasses of Coke Zero.  That's how!  Villa has regained a fan in me...good hoagies and Coke Zero...SWEET!

QWulotABSW1x2u-8bRyunA.text: A little bit of a hole in the wall/dive type of place, with a pizzeria in front and a bar in the back. But nice, salt-of-the-earth people serving and cooking. My old school pepperoni and mushroom pizza was great. Good ingredients, well prepared and fair price.  I'll be back.

V6sssLxfzs1Z5waxfmn0Tw.text: Salad just okay. Iceburg lettuce :(. Pizza pretty good.

rngnZq5tCWoczJ6S7xAJmA.text: Haven't tried anything but the pizza, but when I want a quick slice downtown, this is my go-to place.

SK11qgCW4JjA_szMfptrxg.text: Meh - it's not that there was anything bad about the pizza, it just didn't blow me away or anything.  Good for a quick lunch at the counter.

ysMC9mg5Plm1iH_XeCNpKA.text: ZERO Stars.  Today, my friend in a wheelchair came in and his friends wanted to sit at the bar for a slice.  They asked if there was an exception to the rule about being at the bar.  The manager told my friend that he could not be accommodated.  That's illegal and immoral and absolutely disgusting.

RIxP8kV3H6BiI_P56W3Z4Q.text: Jekyll and Hyde  Lunch and the counter in front:  the product is good but the service and people skills are horrible. A bit pricy too. All unacceptable for an area with so much competition for your lunch dollar  Drinks and the bar in the back:  while it's lacking in craft beers, the service and very friendly atmosphere makes up for it. I'm enjoying a Small Adams now and just taking it all in.  Hard to believe this is the same establishment that runs the lunch crew.

photos.caption: Photo of Villa Reale Pizzeria & Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Sam Adams
Photo of Villa Reale Pizzeria & Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. The bar

YFCfTR6TBpYLNJ93BSxeDg.text: I work Nearby and decided to give this place another try.My first time at Villa I found a hair baked into my pizza ( and not a hair from your head) Gross. It had been about a year and I thought maybe they cleaned up their act. My mistake. I ordered a slice of pepperoni pizza and took it to go, I opened my box and took a couple bites then  noticed something moving underneath the parchment paper in the box. There was a small roach in the box with my pizza!   I took the box back and respectfully approached a waitress not near any other customers so that I didn't make a scene. I asked for my money back and let them know there was a roach still alive in my pizza box. I got no apology! It was almost as if I inconvenienced them by bringing it back.   DO NOT EAT HERE !!!!

X6-3AZ4rnwx5mlU6DQjpBQ.text: Yummy pizza and excellent service! We walked here from our hotel late evening on a Friday. Wasn't too busy. Pizza a little pricey but fresh and authentic with great flavor and an amazing crust.  Which in my opinion totally makes or breaks a pizza. The wedsing soup was yum-o! I waa fighting a super painful and nasty sore throat and the server made me a hot tottie witb her personal honey she brings in. That with the soup really did help sooth my throat.   I didn't get pictures but I highly recommend this little piece of pizza heaven!

fAoEfzAH8vT88p_w9qmkcw.text: Came here after hitting up Piratefest at the David Lawrenceville Convention Center.  Food was decent, but as others said was probably overpriced.  It was super convient as a downtown spot for us and the kids liked it which is a plus.  In the end, the three stars is perfect for this place, got the job done.  Not great or poor, just decent pixza.

_brJmlvYU5Pc7YbYg--0QA.text: Bar review here since "Bar" isn't listed.  This is the bar attached to the pizza joint.   I LOVE "dive" bars so I wanted to love this place, but I wasn't feeling everything.  AMAZING prices for the city. $6 for a double jack and coke?  Yes,  please! And they are strong.     Service is hit and miss.  Staff seems acquainted to a smaller amount of people so a full bar makes them nervous. We got most drinks at the bar but the bartender came around once to our table. And then she left the bar for like 10 minutes...that seemed a bit strange. Perhaps a bar waitress would be beneficial. We probably would have ordered food if someone asked us if we'd like to order.   Since we couldn't order food, I have no comments on that. :(  Location is down an alley way. A bit foreboding but I guess that's what you get at an inner-city dive bar. Seems to be a hangout for locals and after-work types. Pretty small area but lots of tables. Get there early to snag one because you won't have any available if you wait til 5:15 PM on a Friday. Bathrooms are down a set of stairs in the pizza joint. Felt like descending a mountain but maybe that was the booze. Also, the stalls are on a platform which made my 6'0" frame have to stoop to get in. Bathroom = shady.   While I would go back, my husband stated he wouldn't. I didn't get the vibe he did but he usually can read places pretty well so I'll probably listen to his opinion on this one. But if you want a cheap drink, this is your spot in the city.

Zt56LN-NkIM0kMJiqHLnbw.text: This is a great little stop on Smithfield Street.  Frankie the bartender is a major plus and the food across the board is a plus. They offer a wide range of pasta dishes, hoagies, and pizza. I have to recommend the pizza. Though i have tried about a dozen dishes and no complaint. I usually get a slice of pizza and today I added in a side of meatballs. I do want to add you won't be paying a fortune at this place.  The service can get bogged down at lunch but the staff will get you in and out. Try it out and go hungry! I bet you won't spend $10. Bring a few friends and split a pie. ;)

photos.caption: Photo of Villa Reale Pizzeria & Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Slice of pie!
Photo of Villa Reale Pizzeria & Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Side of meatballs...

4xnXiM26_Df1bYieej2Npg.text: So I started a new job downtown (I moved from NYC during the summer), and some coworkers took me here just last week for lunch.  Since the move from NY, I'd been really craving some quality, New York-style pizza, and hadn't had a ton of luck finding any (although the search introduced me to some excellent "Pittsburgh-style" pizza joints, so I'm not complaining.)    Villa Reale really came through.  I loved that you could order a slice with basically whatever toppings you wanted (I'm used to being at the mercy of whatever "slice" pie has been languishing under a heat lamp for 3 hours).  I ordered a pepperoni and sausage slice, and the small feast that was presented to me did not disappoint.  The slice was huge, the pepperoni crispy, the sauce really balanced (not too sweet, not too garlicy), the cheese fresh and delicious and the crust...oh man...thin and crisp on the outside, pillowy soft on the inside.  One slice was perfect to fill me up for lunch, too.    Full disclosure: while the wait staff is so friendly, they do get overwhelmingly busy at lunch.  We went to the place at 11:00 so we could sit at a table (if you want to dine-in and order a slice during lunch, you can only sit at the counter, not a table, after 11:30) and by 11:30 the place was standing room only.  My coworkers informed me that somehow, their pizzas are even better when ordered by the pie (hard for me to fathom) and also that their hoagies are delicious, so I'm sure I'll be trying one of those next time.    It's not the most inexpensive pizza joint downtown (I think my slice ended up being $4-$4.50) but if you're a recovering Noo Yawker like me looking to fulfill some culinary nostalgia, this is your place.

VEurZmNUPdXTZjeB1TwYcw.text: About the best Long Island you can get! Food was great except every time I got a salad the lettuce was almost frozen. The zucchini planks are the BEST... pizza was great! Quite a great dive!

AXy7r-z93x13fI7fMPLJ8Q.text: This is my favorite place for pizza and hoagies and well i love beer too ! I love the guys making the food always entertaining to listen to them joke around ! The bartender always makes me smile ! This is how i like my pizza ! The cheese is great quality not that cheap stuff other use ! The bread on the hoagies makes my love of bread go to the next level ! The family who owns this business are so friendly and loveable , they really do care about thers customers and make you feel at home ! After 41 years i hope this place stays are for another 41 years ! Love stopping here before pens games and get my favorite XL with pep , mush ,and sausage oh and xtra cheese ! Wash it down with a cold beer and im off to watch the pens ! How can you not injoy a great pizza and a pens win perfect combo !

gtEk6xQFse7Cncacs29M7A.text: I didn't discover the Villa until a year and a half after working in the city!  it is kind of tucked away, but the place is always busy.  I have only been there for lunch, and have never disliked anything I got.  They have the pizza you can buy by the slice and pick your toppings along with their many other specials.  The one bartender there is super nice and wears the cutest hats.... I think their homemade sauce is really good too.  The restaurant could use some major updating and remodeling.  otherwise it is a good lunch stop!

uY2QrzrDi9oBQ0B0g0MlCw.text: It's a time warp walking in, and generally not my fave slice the burgh,  but if you're having a major cheese craving, Villa is your jam.  The plain slices are 2.68, but they are so huge and just covered in cheese, you, for sure, only need one for lunch, and the sauce is pretty unoffensive and the crust is almost perfect.  I've yet to  try anything but the pizza, but from what I've seen, it looks like the kind of place where you'd split a dish because the plates are heaping.    Also, they are one of the few places around serving soft serve and who doesn't love soft serve?  Where  has all the soft serve gone?

BHDgT_Hr00Z1Sbw_mSFfCw.text: This review is solely on the service. The food is delicious. The problem is that they don't have enough  people working there to deal with the lunch crowd in the heart of downtown. Also if u just want a slice or two they put exactly that in the oven. They don't make whole pies and slice them up for individual slice orders. Which makes the wait even longer. Also the girls working the register are also the waitresses, so there's often no one at the register to take your order. Also I watched the only guy who does the pizzas burn 2 pies because he was too busy running his mouth. Once u get your food, assuming it's correct, it's good, but good luck with that

TTxttF6qln5a4cLqevKqdQ.text: Worst. Service. Ever.  The woman who runs the register seems disinterested in working and completely irritated by the presence of customers.  Hopefully she is somehow related to ownership , since that would at least explain her continued employment.  The pizza itself is very good.  A bit pricey, but huge slices.  And it's a good thing, because worst.service.ever.

zVvAGwHDP3RpzLBMuqd4TQ.text: I have been coming to Villa Reale since I took a job in town. The service is fine at the counter. However, on the last two occasions where I have eaten here, the pizza has been burnt or was sitting out too long.

yq2ndmx5AoNTBZ38hEaWUw.text: Well folks, it looks like the end of this bee-yoo-tee-full October weather we've been having is nigh!  Tomorrow brings the cooler, more rainy weather we'd been so accustomed to before this autumnal respite.  I had one last chance to dine al fresco today.  So which type of fare would be best for outdoor dining?  Hotdogs?  Nah, I'd already done that.  Hoagies?   Hey, now we're talkin'!  MMMM!  To quote Adam Sandler, "Hoagies-n-grinders, hoagies-n-grinders" (but no navy beans, navy beans!).  Villa Reale may be a typical downtown pizza shop, but they've got good hoagies here.  I went for the 6" pepperoni topped lettuce, tomato, onions & cheese and a brewed ice tea.  It was the perfect way to end a season of outdoor lunches.

ifPCPjS8ki16WyLIFb5_gg.text: The guys over at Slice (slice.seriouseats.com) have a theory called "The Pizza Cognition Theory" This theory states that one's pizza preferences are derived from their first truly memorable pizza experience. While our tastes may vary as we age, ultimately we are on a quest to recapture that first great pizza taste. Villa Reale is the place of my first great pizza memory (groan if you may but it's True). Growing up in Latrobe I had become accustomed to mediocre, chain pizza. Not until I was about 12 did I get my first taste of super thin, floppy, extra cheesy, greasier than normal pizza. This was the stuff I dreamed of. My dad took me here prior to my first ever Pens game. The Villa holds a soft spot in his heart as well due to the many many post work nights he spent here slugging beers and eating pizza with friends. Fast forward 13 years and now I am the one working downtown, slugging beers and eating post work pizza. Unfortunately though, Villa Reale has become so expensive that treating it as a weekly stop is a bit unreasonable. While the pizza is still super thin, floppy, extra cheesy, greasier than normal, I have trouble paying $15 for a slice of pepperoni, a coke, and a side salad. On another occasion my dad requested to come here as his payment for helping me move. A medium calzone, a slice of pepperoni, and two cokes ran me $35. Villa Reale, please come to your senses and adjust your prices. While you played a significant role in my childhood, you are pricing yourself out of my adulthood.

BgtA9Ovr5Rvx6CN2A9RR4Q.text: Done with this place...  It seems every time we go there they get slower and slower.  Today we waited 50 minutes for a cheese pizza that we never got before walking out.  I complain to the guy making pizzas and he says "you're not the only one's here".... Well, he secured the fact that I will never be back again.

9-7n3bJoWLv0Al_jWSBQuw.text: The canned mushrooms are gone!  Hurray!  Went back today for lunch for a pepperoni and mushroom Calzone.  It was huge!  The price was $12.25 which is a little high for lunch but it was very enjoyable.  The dough is very thick.  This is the best Calzone I have ever had.  It is filled with lots of cheese and toppings.

qgbi4x6ES_HEsoFubck8WA.text: Best pizza is Pittsburgh. I have been eating there for years. Most consistent delicious pizza. Good hoagies.And if you need a slice or 2 on the go, they are huge. If you want a drink just in to the back where the bar is and get a pitcher of beer and a large pepperoni.

pL-PRwAvKDmOMGS_hOk-Lw.text: We ordered from Villa Reale due to its proximity to our hotel (and the fact that it's open after 7pm--what's up with this city? Are they all at home watching football and hockey games? Not that I could blame them!)  The pizza's alright. The crust is great, but when I tried to peel off the first piece, the cheese stayed in the box. :( Maybe it froze while we were running back to the hotel.   We also got some fried mushrooms, which are excellent. They come with a tomato-based dipping sauce. Mmm. We found out later that this is one of the few places you can get beer (to take out) after 7pm. Good to know.  Overall, it was fine, but not outstanding.

XXKVnWq3_CPW-lAWsSjaVw.text: I was really impressed with this place! I found out about it through the Ritual app and I ordered 2 slices. I am PICKY when it comes to pizza having come from the eastern side of the state where we're spoiled with NY style. So when I say this pizza is good, it says something.   The slices were HUGE and everything was perfect. The sauce was delicious and they weren't shy about the amount they put on. The cheese was also the perfect amount. Too much cheese on a pizza (I might be alone with this statement) is overwhelming.  Their fries were iffy. Tasted like they haven't changed the oil in a while or something. However, I don't expect top notch fries from a pizza place.   I'll def be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Villa Reale Pizzeria & Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

P0siSiLZfTEKvJ8u6tVNXw.text: Well I read some of the previous reviews about having to wait in line. What that told me is this place must be good. It did not disappoint,  my husband and I split an antipasto salad which was large and delicious. We both had a slice of pizza and it was delicious- very large slices and very delicious. We both would recommend this little spot! Service was excellent too.

kEi9VuSIAo6w8_OU_lASXw.text: The food is good, especially the pizza slices. Too bad, cuz they only serve you if you sit in a certain area, which fills up at lunch time. So if you go there from 11:30-2:00 for slices and the 6-8 seats at the bar are taken and you sit at a table, they won't serve you slices. It's completely ridiculous. They're always packed at lunch so don't expect to get slices unless it's to go or you show up at 11.

4z_U38FE5yzQ-pB-siscdw.text: My co-worker and I went to get lunch here, and I got fried foods, but she got a salad.  Her salad was old & the lettuce was discolored. When receiving the bill at the table, we said something about how the salad looked bad. The waitress said 'Ok, I'll let them know,' and that was it. No offer for a new one. No offer to remove/discount it. NOTHING.  When going to pay at the counter, we once again said something - and she completely overlooked it. Many other places around here to eat - ones that have the basics of Hospitality down.

pM5Ow5Xr5benj9Fou6N8YA.text: If you would enjoy waiting 45 minutes for 1 slice of plain pizza at lunchtime then yeah this is your place.

rCU5OyhQRCtJAT-9WhMKUA.text: Good quality pizza with fantastic cheese. The atmosphere is home-ish. The service is fast and the food affordable. Pizza was definitely better than the spaghetti.

VxzHRmaQ0HT41KceM3fdpg.text: This is a long overdue review. I stopped by here with some friends while at Anthrocon! I think there were a ton of people in the back room area however the dining room was pretty empty and quiet. No one greeted us, despite making eye contact with us, and we had to awkwardly seat ourselves before a woman came to our table with silverware and menus. She was nice and polite but the service was rather slow even though we were practically the only customers there. It was nice because it was quiet and had pretty lighting, but the dining area definitely wasn't very clean.  I ordered an Italian hoagie, which was good, but not anything spectacular or out of the ordinary. Prices weren't bad for the hoagies but the pizza slices were kinda pricey. So overall, the food was good but the service and cleanliness definitely could use some improvement.

photos.caption: Photo of Villa Reale Pizzeria & Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Italian Hoagie
Photo of Villa Reale Pizzeria & Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Italian Hoagie

0E2G64Tl9ZacbXIuw3464w.text: Family owned and operated and you feel like a close cousin as soon as you sit down! The pizza is authentic and delicious with toppings covering every inch. Even the salads and sides are exactly what you want out of this mom and pop shop! The waitresses and bartenders are funny and hardworking as well as genuinely nice people. I have no idea what all these stuck up, overworked business class curmudgeons in Pittsburgh are expecting! But, being away from home for an extended time found me back at the table everyday! Love this place!

JXCnY0eyi3R1E4r5ry_duQ.text: Delicious pizza. When we first walked in we had to ask if we should seat ourselves.  Two employees that were there never acknowledged us or initiated conversation. However, after being seated the server was very nice and the pizza was delicious. We are from Chicago and it's hard to find good pizza in any other city but this was definitely worth the stop in here.  Definitely recommend

wAasB6wL5xrUmsxUvpmDpg.text: I really believe that Villa is a hidden gem in downtown Pittsburgh. Without a doubt, some of the best pizza I've had in the area. Consistently good food, and great service. The sandwiches are enormous and always very good. I love Villa, very decently priced, and a great place to stop for lunch.

1dXAnYUJCt2Kx21zZdaoIA.text: Swung by for a quick lunch. I think this was only my second or third time here.  Got an Italian hoagie that was ok. Just what you'd expect to get from any pizza/hoagie style shop. I doubt I'll go back anytime soon only because there are so many other options downtown for this sort of fare. Also for what I got I found it to be a bit expensive.

z6kyAqfOvhROayVmLE9Kew.text: Best pizza downtown, arguably the entire city. Some menu items on the more expensive side but quality and quantity are king here.

photos.caption: Photo of Villa Reale Pizzeria & Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States
Photo of Villa Reale Pizzeria & Restaurant - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

iqKW3M3WU6Wzq6H8qom5jg.text: After many years of going to,and enjoying the pizza there ,that will never happen again. I ordered a pizza tonight and it was horrible. I called it in ,half sausage half plain. Easy right? Nope, got home to find all sausage and it was very obvious that the pizza had been sitting around for a while. Cold and dry. It was a leftover , I was the last customer of the night.Like I said I have been going there for years and know the product. I called to voice my displeasure and the woman that answered could have not cared less. Well another one bites the dust.

Qj6SvoDCHnrCG3JDUkfDEw.text: Traveling through town and looking for a descent restaurant to dine at. Welcomed to Villa with a rude server who was angry when our group of 12 came in 4 hours from closing. Was spoken to in a rude tone all night by the one server who was working. Food was ordered and sat in the cooking window for several minutes before having to ask if we could have our food. All vegetables on pizza were canned and watered down the pizza. Garlic bread was very burnt and when asked to remake was told "it was not that bad". Several issues with etiquette as we were constantly wondering if she was being serious. Personally enjoyed my salad and ravioli as portions are moderately large here. Calzone was huge and would feed 2 people well, although asked for a box and was never give one. Sounds like an average place for lunch, just be ready for a wait.

9YrxzRZ3P1hDrMyvFNkqKA.text: Traveling, not local. Stopped in due to recommendation from local. Food is decent, service horrible. Dominick the manager was a complete pompous jerk when I tried to speak with him about my concerns. Will not be back.

FwYtCkOCHC0VeizJ5cSCkg.text: Still hating this place. Due to Villa Reale's proximity to my work locale I find myself dining here more often then I would like to admit. The latest disaster lunch was an Italian sausage. The sausage was flavorless and dry to the point of being mummified.  I have little else to add about how worthless this location is and I do wish that it would cease to exist.

a0Cvm7y0xIy4XfcaCaNhVA.text: This is my favorite happy hour spot. The drinks and food are cheap and there's nothing trendy about this place which is awesome.   You can always grab a table with colleagues and they sell pizza by the slice and it's so good. It has that New York pizza taste.   The two women that work the bar are also great. They are quick and I honestly don't know how they manage to keep the place moving when it's busy.

Cc_6jiJWCupiis8bJmnmpg.text: This little pizza dive defines three stars. Pizza, hoagies, pop, some beer. Nothing to write home about but it gets the job done if you're hungry.   Stopped here after pirate fest at the David L. Lawrence Convention Center for a quick bite and it did its job.   Downside: The credit card machine was down so it was cash only and they just mopped the floor so it smelled like bleach.

gibWAo0693qfhNYJ1yPm8w.text: Way to expensive for the quality of the pizza, cleanliness of the restaurant and the service level provided by staff.  This place is delusional thinking they can charge $16 for a medium cheese pizza.  Bill total for 2 soft drinks and a medium pepperoni pizza was $24.42.  The pizza is decent, but not that good. Employees look like bums off the street and struggle to privide basic service.   I've eaten here numerous times over the past 10 years and I think the slow decline is starting to accelerate

Jbv5pytOFMNIRpuLG4k4hA.text: Well as others have noted, the customer service is a bit dicey. I ordered a steak and cheese hoagie and it arrived in a burnt bun. The portion size was large however they uses some type of generic wafer  thin steak.   It tasted OK. Nothing to rave about and at 11 bucks for a flat Coke and the mediocre steak and cheese I really can't recommend the place. I may try the pizza but other reviews noted it was pricy.   On a side note, the staff could spend less time talking hockey, politics, and general bull jive and look after the customers. No refills, no checks on the food, nothing. Had I not flagged the waitress with my card I would have waited to pay as well.
